name: Service
notice: Fields with (*) are mandatory and must be completed in order to submit this form. Leaving optional fields blank will remove the relevant heading from the published resource/provider profile.

description.text: Full Name of the Provider/Organisation offering Resources and acting as main contact point for the Resources.
An abbreviation of the Resource Name as assigned by the Provider.
The node in which the Service belongs to.
The name of the organisation that manages or delivers the resource, or that coordinates the Resource delivery in a federated scenario.
The name(s) of (all) the Provider(s) that manage or deliver the Resource in federated scenarios.
Webpage with information about the Resource usually hosted and maintained by the Provider.

A high-level description in fairly non-technical terms of a) what the Resource does, functionality it provides and Resources it enables to access, b) the benefit to a user/customer delivered by a Resource; benefits are usually related to alleviating pains (e.g., eliminate undesired outcomes, obstacles or risks) or producing gains (e.g. increased performance, social gains, positive emotions or cost saving), c) list of customers, communities, users, etc. using the Resource.

Short catch-phrase for marketing and advertising purposes. It will be usually displayed close to the Resource name and should refer to the main value or purpose of the Resource. Ideally less than 60 characters.

suggestion.text: Link to the logo/visual identity of the Resource. The logo will be visible at the Portal. If there is no specific logo for the Resource the logo of the Provider may be used. Go to the Resource Provider's website --> Right Click on the Resource Provider's logo on the website --> Select 'Copy Image Link' --> Paste it in the below field.

description.text: Links to video, slideshow, photos, screenshots with details of the Provider.
Short description of the Multimedia content.
Link to use cases supported by this Resource.
A named group of Providers that offer access to the same type of Resources.
A named group of Providers that offer access to the same type of Resources, within the defined domain.
A named group of Providers that offer access to the same type of Resources.
A named group of Providers that offer access to the same type of Resources, within the defined domain.
Type of users/customers that commissions a Provider to deliver a Resource.
The way a user can access the service/resource (Remote, Physical, Virtual, etc.).
Eligibility/criteria for granting access to users (excellence-based, free-conditionally, free etc.).
Keywords associated to the Resource to simplify search by relevant keywords.

suggestion.text: Add one Tag in each entry. For multi-word keywords, please use '-' to concatenate words. Suggested length is 20 characters

description.text: Service Category identifies the broad category of the service being described in the Service Profile. Possible values can be selected from the Controlled Vocabulary, and multiple categories can be selected. We encourage Providers to suggest additional categories using the "Other" category, but only broad, generally useful suggestions will be accepted.

Marketplace Location specifies the section(s) of the EOSC Marketplace where the service being described in the Service Profile should be displayed. Possible values can be selected from the Controlled Vocabulary, and multiple categories can be selected. The values are set by the Marketplace team. Requests for new "locations" can be made through the Helpdesk and will be considered by the Marketplace team.
Does Service consist a generic service or resource bringing significant value to two or more research infrastructures?
Locations where the Resource is offered.
Languages of the (user interface of the) Resource.
List of geographic locations where data, samples, etc. are stored and processed.
It is strongly recommended to include here a stable generic contact such as info@ or contact@
The Technology Readiness Level of the Resource (to be further updated in the context of the EOSC).
Phase of the Resource life-cycle.
List of certifications obtained for the Resource (including the certification body).
List of standards supported by the Resource.
List of open source technologies supported by the Resource.
Version of the Resource that is in force.
Date of the latest update of the Resource.
Summary of the Resource features updated from the previous version.
List of other Resources required to use this Resource.
List of other Resources that are commonly used with this Resource.
List of suites or thematic platforms in which the Resource is engaged or Providers (Provider groups) contributing to this Resource.
The ID of the Catalogue this Provider is originally registered at.
Name of the funding body that supported the development and/or operation of the Resource.
Name of the funding program that supported the development and/or operation of the Resource.
Name of the project that supported the development and/or operation of the Resource.
The URL to a webpage to ask more information from the Provider about this Resource.
Link to the Resource user manual and documentation.
Webpage describing the rules, Resource conditions and usage policy which one must agree to abide by in order to use the Resource.
Link to the privacy policy applicable to the Resource.
Information about the access policies that apply.
Webpage with the information about the levels of performance of the Resource that a Provider is expected to deliver.
Webpage to training information on the Resource.
Webpage with monitoring information about the Resource.
Webpage with information about planned maintenance windows for the Resource.
Information on the ordering process type.
Webpage through which an order for the Resource can be placed.
Webpage with the supported payment models and restrictions that apply to the Resource.
Webpage with the information on the price scheme for the Resource in case the customer is charged for.
